PIONEER HISTORY: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to the Saskatchewan Archives Office in Regina, Saskatchewan, where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our province.

Name: Mr. A. H. Bjorndahl

Address: 128 Bjorndahl, Tobias M.

Birthplace: Norway

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping? 1904

Where did you set up housekeeping? Regina, Saskatchewan

Where had you been living before that? Norway

For how many people did you prepare meals? 5

How far was it to your nearest store? 3 miles

How often would a visit be made to the store? Monthly

What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, sugar, salt, tea, coffee, butter, eggs, milk, meat, vegetables, fruit, canned goods, tobacco, newspapers, magazines

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand or style flour did you use in the early years? Robin Red

In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.75

How much did you use graham flour? None

Whole wheat flour? None

Was flour milled locally? No

What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal, rice, oats, barley, buckwheat, rye, millet

What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $0.50

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes

How did you grind it? With a hand mill

From growing your own wheat to buying it at the store, how much did prices change? Prices have increased over the years

Remember the food a little scarcity

12. WATER SUPPLY

Where did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (well, river, slough, dugout) No

How far was this water from your home? About 90 feet on the Hinsdale Road

How was it brought to the home? (pail, barrel, tank) Barrels as a rule

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

After we moved to Watkins we had a well right by our kitchen door, and the town has a city hook up, so from our Mundal we to supply water for the town for seven years.

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

After we moved to Montana we had a well. We used to draw water from the river, and we also kept the rainwater from our marmalade jars to supply water for the garden for many years.
